resource_name: Springfield-Greene County Park Board: Chesterfield Family and Aquatic Center
short_description: Featues a gymnasium, indoor track, cardio exercise and free weight rooms, aerobics, indoor cycling, childcare, game room, a 28-foot rock climbing wall and a community room for rent. resource_name: Springfield-Greene County Park Board: Cooper Tennis Complex
short_description: 2006 USTA/ Missouri Valley Section Facility of the Year, Cooper Tennis offers 12 indoor courts and 17 outdoor lighted courts with the outdoor 2,500-seat Mediacom Tennis Stadium. The facility houses a full-service pro shop with racquet stringing and grip service; locker rooms with showers, a fitness room with exercise equipment and free weights, a conference room and a large meeting area. Lessons and leagues available for all ages and skill levels. Home to the Greater Springfield Community Olympic Development Program (CODP) for Tennis. Also home to the Springfield Lasers pro World TeamTennis franchise. Lasers home matches played in Springfield throughout July.

resource_name: Springfield-Greene County Park Board: Cruse Dog Park
short_description: This six-acre park is Springfield’s first off-leash dog park featuring designated areas for small and large dogs to play and run. The park is located just west of Kansas Expressway, off Grand Street. The fenced facility features water stations for both canines and humans. Open seven days a week, dawn-to-dusk, weather and conditions permitting. Dogs must be registered and owners must privide specific vaccination records.

resource_name: Springfield-Greene County Park Board: Dan Kinney Family Center
short_description: The Park Board’s newest family center opened in 2013 with a gymnasium, 1/16 mile indoor walking/running tack, fitness center, aerobics room, childcare, game room, community room and locker rooms. Located in Dan Kinney Park adjacent to Miracle League Ball Field. A variety of memberships and day passes are available.

resource_name: Springfield-Greene County Park Board: Doling Family Center and Indoor Aquatics Center
short_description: Full-service family center in historic Doling Park includes gymnasium, indoor track, weight room, cardio equipment, aerobics room, game room, childcare and locker rooms. The new Doling Indoor Aquatics Center features a zero-depth entry recreational pool, slide, water spouts, water-brella and other interactive features. Also includes a three-lane-25-meter lap pool and therapeutic whirlpool spa. A variety of memberships and day passes are available.

resource_name: Springfield-Greene County Park Board: Doling History Museum
short_description: Located on site of Doling’s former roller skating rink, the museum features Doling Park’s 130-year history, including memorabilia from the bygone amusement park. Courtyard rentals available. Open Tuesday, Friday and Sunday, April-October.

resource_name: Springfield-Greene County Park Board: Founders Park
short_description: Take a walking tour at the founding site of Springfield. Pictures and narrative text take you through our city’s history at this downtown Springfield park location. Walk the greenway trail to nearby Jordan Valley Park. Founders Park is home to a summer weekday concert series, summer Movies at Founders Park and other activities. Free.

resource_name: Springfield-Greene County Park Board: Gray-Campbell Farmstead
short_description: A historical preservation site that hosts special events that are educational in nature throughout the year; the Farmstead, located at 2400 S. Scenic in Springfield in Nathanael-Greene/Close Memorial Park, has the oldest cabin in Springfield and the one-room Liberty Schoolhouse. It is operated and maintained by the Friends of the Gray-Campbell Farmstead. Weekend tours available.

resource_name: Springfield-Greene County Park Board: Horton Smith Golf Course
short_description: This 18-hole, 6,312-yard course with driving range is perfect for the novice, intermediate or highly skilled player. Full line pro shop with golf equipment, private golf lessons, junior clinics and leagues throughout the sunmer. Course was named for Springfield’s first local champion, winner of the inaugural Masters Tournament in 1934, Horton Smith.

resource_name: Springfield-Greene County Park Board: Jordan Valley Park
short_description: Jordan Valley Park, located in the heart of Springfield is an urban meadow vast enough to find places for solitude and places to socialize. Splash in the Ozarks Fountain and Stream; play with K-Man and the Springfield Wagon; enjoy a picnic lunch with family and friends, walk or bike the Jordan Creek Greenway. Adjacent to Mediacom Ice Park and the Creamery Arts Center.

resource_name: Springfield-Greene County Park Board: Killian Sports Complex
short_description: A 1,080-seat softball stadium and five other fields make up the lighted complex. The stadium is home to the Missouri State University Softball team. A number of annual state, regional, and national softball tournaments are hosted at the complex.

resource_name: Springfield-Greene County Park Board: Lake Springfield Boathouse and Marina
short_description: If you like the outdoors, you’ll love this 153-acre property with more than one mile of shoreline and the five-mile James River Water Trail. The beautiful Lake Springfield Boathouse, overlooking the lake, is available for special events along with public and private bookings. Canoe/kayak rentals available, weather permitting.

resource_name: Springfield-Greene County Park Board: Mediacom Ice Park
short_description: Recreational and competitive ice sports can be found at the Ice Park. Enjoy open ice skating, figure skating, or join a hockey team (lessons and leagues available for all ages). The Ice Park is home to the Missouri State Ice Bears Div. I and II hockey teams; The Springfield Express Junior-A hockey team, the Springfield Youth Hockey Association; and the Jordan Valley Figure Skating Club. The facility is perfect for birthday parties, group functions or special events. Group discounts available.

resource_name: Springfield-Greene County Park Board: Miracle League Ball Field
short_description: The Betty and Bobby Allison Miracle League Field was built to help players with physical or developmental disabilities hit, run, catch and play ball. The 1/3-size field features a barrier-free, cushioned synthetic surface which enables players using wheelchairs or walkers to glide unrestricted. The entire facility is accessible, next to Dan Kinney Park Universal Playground. Kids and adult leagues in spring and fall.

resource_name: Springfield-Greene County Park Board: Mizumoto Japanese Stroll Garden
short_description: Unique seven-acre garden of Japanese design, complete with teahouse, moon bridge, pagoda and three lakes. Located in Nathanael Greene/Close Memorial Park. Hosts Japanese Fall Festival each September. Open Thursday-Monday, April-October; admission is $3.

resource_name: Springfield-Greene County Park Board: Northview Center

Programs include arts & crafts, billiards, fitness, computers and hospitality with library and book exchange. SWMOA provides services and lunch Monday-Friday (except holidays). Northview also houses the Accessible Recreation programs for persons 18+ years with disabilities. Northview may be rented for meetings or special events.
